overview: This subject aims to continue students’ process of self-exploration and theory/practice integration, enabling them to progress a knowledge of self from Professional Identity 1 into a knowledge of professional self in multiple social work contexts. Students will draw on their previous course work, field education placements and emerging e-portfolio to create and curate a consolidated personal Professional Identity Framework. They will use this framework to articulate their professional social work identity across academic and multiple workplace settings.
ilo: Identify and describe the elements of social work practice and frameworks for illustrating social work professional identity
Identify and describe different organisational and systemic contexts of social work practice.
generic_skills: Understand recent developments in social work contexts of practice
Competently communicate in ways relevant to both academic and practice context.

content.Name: Supervised Field Placement 1B
content.Teaching period: July (On Campus - Parkville)October (On Campus - Parkville)April (On Campus - Parkville)

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Written essay articulating their professional social work identity drawing on evidence from their e-portfolio
Individual presentation of e-portfolio and social work professional identity for a practice context
